creator: zhjicheng@yahoo.com
text:
We got following problem when our application uses Batik1.5.1 from time to 
time.  The same operation will not cause any problem when our application uses 
Batik1.5.  Would you please give me some clues on that?

Thanks in advance,
Frank

Java(TM) Plug-in: Version 1.4.2_03
Using JRE version 1.4.2_03 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 0, Size: 0
	at org.apache.batik.gvt.CompositeGraphicsNode.checkRange(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.gvt.CompositeGraphicsNode.get(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.swing.svg.JSVGComponent.getCanvasGraphicsNode
(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.swing.svg.JSVGComponent.setGraphicsNode(Unknown 
Source)
	at 
org.apache.batik.swing.svg.JSVGComponent$SVGListener.svgLoadEventDispatchComplet
ed(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.swing.svg.SVGLoadEventDispatcher$2.dispatch(Unknown 
Source)
	at org.apache.batik.util.EventDispatcher.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.util.EventDispatcher.fireEvent(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.batik.util.EventDispatcher$1.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.event.InvocationEvent.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForHierarchy(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(Unknown Source)
	at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(Unknown Source)

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
I might be missing something but I think this can only happen if
your document lacks a root SVG element.

This makes it an invalid SVG document.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Hi Frank,
   Since I haven't heard back I'm going to assume I was correct and close this.
If you disagree feel free to reopen the bug.
